      void noNavBarGoodness()
      Prevent the BottomBar drawing behind the Navigation Bar and making it transparent.
      void noResizeGoodness()
      Don't resize the tabs when selecting a new one, so every tab is the same if you have more than three tabs.
      void noScalingGoodness()
      Don't animate the scaling of the text when selecting a new tab.
      void noTabletGoodness()
      Force the BottomBar to behave exactly same on tablets and phones, instead of showing a left menu on tablets.
      void noTopOffset()
      If you get some unwanted extra padding in the top (such as when using CoordinatorLayout), this fixes it.

    • Method Detail

      • attach

        public static BottomBar attach(android.app.Activity activity,
                               android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Bind the BottomBar to your Activity, and inflate your layout here. Remember to also call onSaveInstanceState(Bundle) inside of your Activity.onSaveInstanceState(Bundle) to restore the state.
        Parameters:
        activity - an Activity to attach to.
        savedInstanceState - a Bundle for restoring the state on configuration change.
        Returns:
        a BottomBar at the bottom of the screen.

        public static BottomBar attach(android.view.View view,
                               android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Bind the BottomBar to the specified View's parent, and inflate your layout there. Useful when the BottomBar overlaps some content that shouldn't be overlapped. Remember to also call onRestoreInstanceState(Bundle) inside of your Activity.onSaveInstanceState(Bundle) to restore the state.
        Parameters:
        view - a View, which parent we're going to attach to.
        savedInstanceState - a Bundle for restoring the state on configuration change.
        Returns:
        a BottomBar at the bottom of the screen.

      • attachShy

        @Deprecated
public static BottomBar attachShy(CoordinatorLayout coordinatorLayout,
                                              android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated. Breaks support for tablets. Use #attachShy(CoordinatorLayout, View, Bundle) instead.

      • attachShy

        public static BottomBar attachShy(CoordinatorLayout coordinatorLayout,
                                  android.view.View userContentView,
                                  android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Adds the BottomBar inside of your CoordinatorLayout and shows / hides it according to scroll state changes. Remember to also call onRestoreInstanceState(Bundle) inside of your Activity.onSaveInstanceState(Bundle) to restore the state.
        Parameters:
        coordinatorLayout - a CoordinatorLayout for the BottomBar to add itself into
        userContentView - the view (usually a NestedScrollView) that has your scrolling content. Needed for tablet support.
        savedInstanceState - a Bundle for restoring the state on configuration change.
        Returns:
        a BottomBar at the bottom of the screen.

      • setFragmentItems

        public void setFragmentItems(android.app.FragmentManager fragmentManager,
                             int containerResource,
                             BottomBarFragment... fragmentItems)
        Set tabs and fragments for this BottomBar. When setting more than 3 items, only the icons will show by default, but the selected item will have the text visible.
        Parameters:
        fragmentManager - a FragmentManager for managing the Fragments.
        containerResource - id for the layout to inflate Fragments to.
        fragmentItems - an array of BottomBarFragment objects.

      • setFragmentItems

        @Deprecated
public void setFragmentItems(android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fragmentManager,
                                         int containerResource,
                                         BottomBarFragment... fragmentItems)
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated. Use either setItems(BottomBarTab...) or setItemsFromMenu(int, OnMenuTabClickListener) and add a listener using setOnTabClickListener(OnTabClickListener) to handle tab changes by yourself. Set tabs and fragments for this BottomBar. When setting more than 3 items, only the icons will show by default, but the selected item will have the text visible.
        Parameters:
        fragmentManager - a FragmentManager for managing the Fragments.
        containerResource - id for the layout to inflate Fragments to.
        fragmentItems - an array of BottomBarFragment objects.

      • setItems

        public void setItems(BottomBarTab... bottomBarTabs)
        Set items for this BottomBar. When setting more than 3 items, only the icons will show by default, but the selected item will have the text visible.
        Parameters:
        bottomBarTabs - an array of BottomBarTab objects.

      • setItems

        public void setItems(int menuRes)
        Set items for this BottomBar from an XML menu resource file. When setting more than 3 items, only the icons will show by default, but the selected item will have the text visible.
        Parameters:
        menuRes - the menu resource to inflate items from.

                                         OnMenuTabSelectedListener listener)

        Deprecated. Use setItems(int) and setOnMenuTabClickListener(OnMenuTabClickListener)instead.

      • setItemsFromMenu

public void setItemsFromMenu(int menuRes,
                                         OnMenuTabClickListener listener)
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated. Use setItems(int) and setOnMenuTabClickListener(OnMenuTabClickListener)instead.

      • setOnItemSelectedListener

        @Deprecated
public void setOnItemSelectedListener(OnTabSelectedListener listener)
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated. Use setOnTabClickListener(OnTabClickListener) instead.

      • setOnTabClickListener

        public void setOnTabClickListener(OnTabClickListener listener)
        Set a listener that gets fired when the selected tab changes. Note: If listener is set after items are added to the BottomBar, onTabSelected will be immediately called for the currently selected tab
        Parameters:
        listener - a listener for monitoring changes in tab selection.

      • setOnMenuTabClickListener

        public void setOnMenuTabClickListener(OnMenuTabClickListener listener)
        Set a listener that gets fired when the selected tab changes, when the tabs are created from an XML menu resource file. Note: If listener is set after items are added to the BottomBar, onMenuTabSelected will be immediately called for the currently selected tab
        Parameters:
        listener - a listener for monitoring changes in tab selection.

      • selectTabAtPosition

        public void selectTabAtPosition(int position,
                                boolean animate)
        Select a tab at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        position - the position to select.

      • setDefaultTabPosition

        public void setDefaultTabPosition(int defaultTabPosition)
        Sets the default tab for this BottomBar that is shown until the user changes the selection.
        Parameters:
        defaultTabPosition - the default tab position.

      • getCurrentTabPosition

        public int getCurrentTabPosition()
        Get the current selected tab position.
        Returns:
        the position of currently selected tab.

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Hide the BottomBar.

      • show

        public void show()
        Show the BottomBar.

      • setMaxFixedTabs

        public void setMaxFixedTabs(int count)
        Set the maximum number of tabs, after which the tabs should be shifting ones with a background color. NOTE: You must call this method before setting any items.
        Parameters:
        count - maximum number of fixed tabs.

      • useFixedMode

        public void useFixedMode()
        Always show the titles and icons also on inactive tabs, even if there's more than three of them.

      • onSaveInstanceState

        public void onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle outState)
        Call this method in your Activity's onSaveInstanceState to keep the BottomBar's state on configuration change.
        Parameters:
        outState - the Bundle to save data to.

      • mapColorForTab

        public void mapColorForTab(int tabPosition,
                           int color)
        Map a background color for a Tab, that changes the whole BottomBar background color when the Tab is selected.
        Parameters:
        tabPosition - zero-based index for the tab.
        color - a hex color for the tab, such as 0xFF00FF00.

      • mapColorForTab

        public void mapColorForTab(int tabPosition,
                           java.lang.String color)
        Map a background color for a Tab, that changes the whole BottomBar background color when the Tab is selected.
        Parameters:
        tabPosition - zero-based index for the tab.
        color - a hex color for the tab, such as "#00FF000".

      • useDarkTheme

        @Deprecated
public void useDarkTheme(boolean darkThemeEnabled)
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated. Use useDarkTheme() instead.

      • useDarkTheme

        public void useDarkTheme()
        Use dark theme instead of the light one. NOTE: You might want to change your active tab color to something else using setActiveTabColor(int), as the default primary color might not have enough contrast for the dark background.

      • ignoreNightMode

        public void ignoreNightMode()
        Ignore the automatic Night Mode detection and use a light theme by default, even if the Night Mode is on.

      • setActiveTabColor

        public void setActiveTabColor(java.lang.String activeTabColor)
        Set a custom color for an active tab when there's three or less items. NOTE: This value is ignored on mobile devices if you have more than three items.
        Parameters:
        activeTabColor - a hex color used for active tabs, such as "#00FF000".

      • setActiveTabColor

        public void setActiveTabColor(int activeTabColor)
        Set a custom color for an active tab when there's three or less items. NOTE: This value is ignored if you have more than three items.
        Parameters:
        activeTabColor - a hex color used for active tabs, such as 0xFF00FF00.

      • setFixedInactiveIconColor

        public void setFixedInactiveIconColor(int iconColor)
        Set a custom color for inactive icons in fixed mode. NOTE: This value is ignored if not in fixed mode.
        Parameters:
        iconColor - a hex color used for icons, such as 0xFF00FF00.

      • setShiftingIconColor

        public void setShiftingIconColor(int iconColor)
        Set a custom color for icons in shifting mode. NOTE: This value is ignored in fixed mode.
        Parameters:
        iconColor - a hex color used for icons, such as 0xFF00FF00.

      • makeBadgeForTabAt

        public BottomBarBadge makeBadgeForTabAt(int tabPosition,
                                        java.lang.String backgroundColor,
                                        int initialCount)
        Creates a new Badge (for example, an indicator for unread messages) for a Tab at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        tabPosition - zero-based index for the tab.
        backgroundColor - a color for this badge, such as "#FF0000".
        initialCount - text displayed initially for this Badge.
        Returns:
        a BottomBarBadge object.

      • makeBadgeForTabAt

        public BottomBarBadge makeBadgeForTabAt(int tabPosition,
                                        int backgroundColor,
                                        int initialCount)
        Creates a new Badge (for example, an indicator for unread messages) for a Tab at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        tabPosition - zero-based index for the tab.
        backgroundColor - a color for this badge, such as 0xFFFF0000.
        initialCount - text displayed initially for this Badge.
        Returns:
        a BottomBarBadge object.

      • setTypeFace

        public void setTypeFace(java.lang.String typeFacePath)
        Set a custom TypeFace for the tab titles. The .ttf file should be located at "/src/main/assets".
        Parameters:
        typeFacePath - path for the custom typeface in the assets directory.

      • setTextAppearance

        public void setTextAppearance(int resId)
        Set a custom text appearance for the tab title.
        Parameters:
        resId - path to the custom text appearance.

      • hideShadow

        public void hideShadow()
        Hide the shadow that's normally above the BottomBar.

      • noNavBarGoodness

        public void noNavBarGoodness()
        Prevent the BottomBar drawing behind the Navigation Bar and making it transparent. Must be called before setting items.

      • noTabletGoodness

        public void noTabletGoodness()
        Force the BottomBar to behave exactly same on tablets and phones, instead of showing a left menu on tablets.

      • noResizeGoodness

        public void noResizeGoodness()
        Don't resize the tabs when selecting a new one, so every tab is the same if you have more than three tabs. The text still displays the scale animation and the icon moves up, but the badass width animation is ignored.

      • noScalingGoodness

        public void noScalingGoodness()
        Don't animate the scaling of the text when selecting a new tab. The text still displays the badass width animation, but the scale animation is ignored.

      • getBarSize

        public void getBarSize(OnSizeDeterminedListener listener)
        Get this BottomBar's height (or width), depending if the BottomBar is on the bottom (phones) or the left (tablets) of the screen.
        Parameters:
        listener - OnSizeDeterminedListener to get the size when it's ready.

      • getBar

        public android.view.View getBar()
        Get the actual BottomBar that has the tabs inside it for whatever what you may want to do with it.
        Returns:
        the BottomBar.

      • noTopOffset

        public void noTopOffset()
        If you get some unwanted extra padding in the top (such as when using CoordinatorLayout), this fixes it.

      • useOnlyStatusBarTopOffset

        public void useOnlyStatusBarTopOffset()
        If your ActionBar gets inside the status bar for some reason, this fixes it.
